it.polimi.ingsw.model.Consequence.Consequence

Packages that use Consequence 
Package Description
it.polimi.ingsw.model  
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Consequence  
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player  
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player.Effect  

  • Uses of Consequence in it.polimi.ingsw.model

    Methods in it.polimi.ingsw.model with parameters of type Consequence 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void Game.receiveConsequence​(Consequence consequence)
    receives the consequence of an action this method is a part of the visitor pattern once the consequence is received, is handled by the game handler
    void GameConsequenceHandler.receiveConsequence​(Consequence consequence)  

  • Uses of Consequence in it.polimi.ingsw.model.Consequence

    Classes in it.polimi.ingsw.model.Consequence that implement Consequence 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  BlockConsequence
    this consequence is thrown when I need to block one or more player this players are now not able to move up their pawns
    class  DestroyTowersConsequence
    this consequence is thrown when a player build the last available block of a certain type, in this case the game have to destroy all the complete tower to recover some pieces
    class  NoConsequence
    this consequence is thrown where the player have done a normal action
    class  VictoryConsequence
    this consequence is thrown when a player win the game in any possible method

  • Uses of Consequence in it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player

    Methods in it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player that return Consequence 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Consequence Player.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    this method calls the build method of its effect and add the name of the player ar the returning consequence
    Consequence Player.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this method calls the move method of its effect and add the name of the player at the returning consequence

  • Uses of Consequence in it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player.Effect

    Fields in it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player.Effect declared as Consequence 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) Consequence MoreBuildNotOnSameEffectTest.consequence  
    Methods in it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player.Effect that return Consequence 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Consequence BasicEffect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    the standard method that build a building by the designated pawn, it's the default build
    Consequence BuildBeforeEffect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    This method is different from the basic one because the player can build before the move, so if it happens, we have to set some parameters in order to have a correct move after the first built
    Consequence BuildUnderItselfEffect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    this method actually build the block of the chosen level in the designated cell but if the player has decided to build a block under his own pawn then I have to force the pawn up one block (the player does not win by forcing from 2nd to 3hd level)
    Consequence CanDestroyEffect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    this overrides the super method until the player has to finish the turn With the finish action, the player could also have a destroy action to be used
    Consequence Effect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)  
    Consequence EffectDecorator.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)  
    Consequence MoreBuildInsideEffect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    this method is the same of basic method but if player built once, he may build another time
    Consequence MoreBuildNotOnSameEffect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    This method decorates the player's effect based on his build for the current turn and changes his state If this is the first build, than the player could build again, so the next state will be BuildAndFinish state, but he will not be able to build on the same cell, so his effect is decorated with a BuildNotOnSameCellEffect
    Consequence MoreBuildOnSameEffect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    This method decorates the player's effect based on his build for the current turn and changes his state If this is the first build, than the player could build again, so the next state will be BuildAndFinish state, but he will be able to build only on the same cell, so his effect is decorated with a BuildOnSameCellEffect
    Consequence MoreMoveEffect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    this method changes the state of the player after he does a basic build action
    Consequence MovePerimeterAgainEffect.build​(Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell, int chosenLevel, java.util.List<Building> buildings)
    this method changes the state of the player after he does a basic build action
    Consequence BasicEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    the standard method that move designated pawn, it's the default move
    Consequence BlockOpponentEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    This method is different from the basic one because the special effect for this player is that if a pawn moves up in his turn, for the next opponent's turns, the other players will not be able to move up
    Consequence BuildBeforeEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell)
    this method changes the state of the player after he does a basic move action
    Consequence CanForceEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this method changes the state of the player after he does a basic move action
    Consequence DownTwoEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this method is the same of basic player, but it return Victory Consequence also if player moves down to two levels
    Consequence Effect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)  
    Consequence EffectDecorator.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)  
    Consequence MoreMoveEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    This method decorates the player's effect based on his move for the current turn and changes his state For the first move the method will change the state to a MoveAndBuild, because after the first move the player could be able to move again
    Consequence MovePerimeterAgainEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    This method is similar to basic, but the player can move again each time pawn moves onto perimeter space is so, after the player moved, the action "build" and also "move" are available For the end of the turn, it's only the action "finish"
    Consequence PushEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this method move pawn on nextposition cell and if the cell is occupied by a opponent pawn, it pushes this pawn in the same direction if is unoccupied
    Consequence SwitchEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this is the method that actually move the pawn, in case of switching with an opponent pawn this method force the opponent pawn in the designatedPawn starting cell
